content.text:
Look at the following description corresponding the the relavant image(s), Then answer a question

***Start of description***

The image shows a nuclear reaction equation: \({}^{6}\text{Li}_3 + ? \rightarrow {}^{7}\text{Li}_3\). This equation represents a nuclear reaction where a lithium-6 nucleus (with 3 protons and 3 neutrons) reacts with an unknown particle (?) to produce a lithium-7 nucleus (with 3 protons and 4 neutrons).

To determine what the "?" represents, we need to consider the conservation of mass and charge in nuclear reactions. The lithium-6 nucleus has a total mass number of 6 (3 protons + 3 neutrons), and the lithium-7 nucleus has a total mass number of 7 (3 protons + 4 neutons). Therefore, the unknown particle must have a mass number of 1 to balance the equation.

Given the options:
A. an alpha particle (which has a mass number of 4)
B. an electron (which has no mass number)
C. a neutron (which has a mass number of 1)
D. a proton (which has a mass number of 1)

The correct answer is C. a neutron, because it has a mass number of 1 and can balance the equation.

***End of description***
Now, answer the question:

<image 1>What does the ? represent in the nuclear reaction

A. an alpha particle
B. an electron
C. a neutron
D. a proton
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
